name: Pearls and Jade Pothos
climate: This plant thrives in a climate that mimics tropical habitats.
Moderate temperatures are ideal, avoiding extreme cold or heat.
Indoors, it prefers a consistently warm and humid atmosphere.
Rapid temperature shifts can stress the plant, hindering growth.
sunlight: Bright, indirect light is optimal for healthy growth.
Direct sunlight may scorch the leaves and should be avoided.
Low light can be tolerated, but growth might be slower.
An east-facing window is often a suitable location indoors.
watering: Water when the top inch of soil feels dry to the touch.
Overwatering can lead to root rot, so check soil moisture first.
During hotter months, it may require more frequent watering.
In winter, watering frequency should be reduced as growth slows.
soil: Well-draining soil is crucial to prevent waterlogging.
A mix of peat-based potting soil and perlite is beneficial.
Soil should retain moisture but also allow for adequate airflow.
Nutrient-rich soil can support vigorous plant growth and health.
toxic: This plant is toxic if ingested by pets or small children.
extra_care_tip: Pruning can help maintain shape and encourage bushier growth.
